SEARCH

All Classes and Interfaces

Class
Description
Author
The Author class represents an author with a first name and a last name.
Book
 
Books
 
CloseFIle
The CloseFile class is responsible for handling the closure of a file operation by resetting the library's file path.
Command
 
CommandImpl
The CommandImpl class implements the Command interface, providing concrete implementations for various commands related to books and users.
Controller
 
ControllerImpl
The ControllerImpl class implements the Controller interface, providing methods to manage operations related to books, users, logging, registration, and file operations.
Engine
 
EngineImpl
The EngineImpl class implements the Engine interface, providing a mechanism to run the application and process user commands.
GnomeSort
The GnomeSort class implements the SortingAlgorithm interface and provides methods to perform Gnome Sort on a list of books based on different criteria.
HelpCommand
 
Library
The Library class represents a library system that manages books and provides various operations on them.
Logger
The Logger class implements the LogOperation interface and handles user login and logout operations.
LogOperation
 
Main
 
OpenFile
The OpenFile class is responsible for handling file operations related to reading book data from a specified file and updating the library accordingly.
Reader
 
Register
The Register class implements the RegisterOperation interface, providing methods to add and remove users from the system.
RegisterOperation
 
SaveAsFile
 
SaveFile
The SaveFile class is responsible for saving the library's data to the file specified in the library's path.
Sorter
The Sorter class provides methods for sorting a list of books using different sorting algorithms.
SortingAlgorithm
 
TextFileReader
The TextFileReader class implements the Reader interface and is responsible for reading key-value pairs from a text file where each line contains a key and a value separated by whitespace.
TextFileWriter
The TextFileWriter class implements the Writer interface and is responsible for writing user data, a map of user key-value pairs, and library book data to a text file.
User
The User class represents a user in the system.
Writer
